articles.author: EMMA BURROWS, DASHA LITVINOVA and JIM HEINTZ
articles.description: President Vladimir Putin sealed his control over Russia for six more years on Monday with a predetermined landslide in an election that followed the harshest crackdown on the opposition and free speech since Soviet times.
articles.title: Putin extends rule in preordained Russian election after harshest crackdown since Soviet era

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.description: A decade ago, President Vladimir Putin seized Crimea from Ukraine, a bold land grab that set the stage for Russia to invade its neighbor in 2022.
articles.title: How Russia's grab of Crimea 10 years ago led to war with Ukraine and rising tensions with the West

articles.author: WAFAA SHURAFA, SAMY MAGDY and TIA GOLDENBERG
articles.description: RAFAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — Israeli forces launched another raid on the Gaza Strip's largest hospital early Monday, saying Hamas militants had regrouped there and had fired on them from inside the compound, where Palestinian officials say tens of thousands of people have been sheltering.
articles.title: Israel launches another raid on Gaza's main hospital, charging that Hamas has regrouped there

articles.author: KIRSTEN GRIESHABER
articles.description: BERLIN (AP) — When Sabine Thonke joined a recent demonstration in Berlin against Germany's far-right party, it was the first time in years she felt hopeful that the growing power of the extremists in her country could be stopped.
articles.title: Germans thought they were immune to nationalism after confronting their Nazi past. They were wrong

articles.author: NICK PERRY and LISA RATHKE
articles.description: ELMORE, Vt. (AP) — Julie wants more donations to the food pantry. Kipp is busy knitting a sweater. Shorty is ready to ask: Why is so much being spent on a truck? The coffee, fresh-baked bread and donuts have been laid out.
articles.title: In Vermont, 'Town Meeting' is democracy embodied. What can the rest of the country learn from it?

articles.author: JONATHAN J. COOPER
articles.description: The lack of excitement many Americans feel about a presidential rematch has heightened interest in alternatives to the major-party candidates, none more so than Robert F.
articles.title: Who is Robert F. Kennedy Jr. and why is he running for president?

articles.author: MARK SHERMAN
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — In a busy term that could set standards for free speech in the digital age, the Supreme Court on Monday is taking up a dispute between Republican-led states and the Biden administration over how far the federal government can go to combat controversial social media posts on topics including COVID-19 and election security.
articles.title: Supreme Court weighs how far federal officials can go to combat controversial posts on hot topics

articles.description: MIAMI (AP) — A charter flight carrying dozens of U.S. citizens fleeing spiraling gang violence in Haiti landed Sunday in Miami, U.S.
articles.title: First charter flight with US citizens fleeing Haiti lands in Miami

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.description: Spring is almost here — officially, at least.The vernal equinox arrives on Tuesday, marking the start of the spring season for the Northern Hemisphere.
articles.title: The spring equinox is here. What does that mean?

articles.author: EDDIE PELLS
articles.description: Even before the brackets came out Sunday, March Madness was a muddled mess. About the closest thing to a sure thing: UConn.The defending champion Huskies earned the top seed in the NCAA Tournament, joined by Houston,Purdue and North Carolina as No.
articles.title: March Madness is here. UConn, Purdue, Houston and North Carolina get top seeding in NCAA Tournament
